Transcript: Cassie: (Hyperventilating) Cassie. What happened? What happened?
Cassie: Edmund.
Edmund: Come on, come on.
Cassie: Oh, my god.
Edmund: Are you all right?
Cassie: Oh, my god. (Sobbing)
Edmund: What happened?

Cassie: Someone was messing with my computer, and then they stole my 
sunglasses, and I came down here, and both tires were slashed, and I just 
totally freaked.
Edmund: Oh, my god. For good reason. It's all right, it's all right.
Cassie: I just want to get out of here.
Edmund: It's okay. Let's just see if you're all right first.
Cassie: I'm fine!
Edmund: Just walk. Walk for me, all right? Just walk. You all right?

Cassie: When I saw your car coming at me, I just... after everything that 
happened, I thought that you were going to run me down. Why are they doing this? 
Why are these people doing this to me? God, it was one thing when they were 
across the ocean and they were going to fancy parties and signing my name to 
room-service bills. But what's next? What if they come after the children?

Edmund: God, I hate this! (Crashing) I hate that I haven't been able to 
take care of you and the children! You've got slashed tires! I can't do anything

something about this now.

Cassie: We don't know these people, edmund, and we don't know their limits, 
okay?
Edmund: Cassie...
Cassie: Edmund, just stop, okay? I just want to go. I just want to go.
Edmund: But...
Cassie: Look, just put the tire iron back.

Edmund: All right. Okay, well, we'll go upstairs and we'll call the police. 
Cassie?
Cassie: Oh. Uh, just getting the keys.
Edmund: Look, maybe it's a better idea if I drive you back to the farm.

Cassie: Why don't you go ahead and go, and I'll meet you there. I'm going to 
have to get, like, new tires.

Edmund: Well, just... (laughs) don't be ridiculous. I'll take you back to 
the farm and we can take care of the tires later.
Cassie: I need to do this.
Edmund: All right, if you're sure that...

Cassie: I am. Thank you. Thank you for saving me and for wanting to protect 
me.
Edmund: Right. Well, hurry home.

Michelle: Okay, so I think our new rule should be all our meetings at the

Tony: All right. Well, I will say that you are the ceo that every employee

Michelle: No one's going to know the difference but you. Come on. Unless

Michelle: (Spooky humming)

Tony: Okay?
Michelle: Got you covered.
Tony: Yeah, I'm sure you do.
Michelle: Wow.
Tony: There.
Michelle: I thought...
Tony: What?
Michelle: I don't know, i just...

Michelle: I was expecting leopard stripes, silk, something. I mean, black?

Tony: Listen, did you come here to talk or swim?
Michelle: Oh, oh. Okay. Okay! No way to treat a new ceo. (Playful scream)
Bill: Hello, aitoro.
Gus: Everybody. Marina, how are you? How's your dad doing?
Marina: Like you care.
Alan: Well, I thought I heard your voice.
Gus: Hey.
Alan: Welcome home, son.
Gus: Thank you.
Alan: Why don't you come in and tell me about your trip, huh?
Gus: It'S... you've got people waiting.
Marina: Oh, it's okay. We're not important.
Alan: Marina, don't you have some trash to take out or something to sweep up?

Marina: As a matter of fact, I'm here about that job description. But danny's

Gus: Why don't you two talk? I'd like to talk to her anyway, if that's okay.
Alan: All right. Enjoy. Danny, it's always good to see you.
Danny: How are you?
Alan: Why don't you come in and tell me how your family is?

Marina: "How's the family?" You mean what's left of it after vinnie salerno 
finished with them. Only a spaulding could be so cold.
Gus: Hmm. So we're all targets now, is that it?
Marina: Oh, you and your family made a big mistake taking on the coopers.

Gus: You can't possibly think that I would purposely try to hurt people in 
your family.

Marina: My dad lost his job and darci. My grandfather is nursing a broken 
heart after your dear old auntie alex betrayed him. And aunt harley? Her whole 
world was run over by a meat truck. All because of you. I hope she gave it to 
you good when she tracked you down.
Gus: She was looking for me?

Marina: Oh, don't get your hopes all up, gus, okay? It was an act of 
desperation. You were her only option after phillip decided to grind company 
into the ground.

Danny: Come on, alan. You wouldn't be sitting behind that desk of yours right 
now if it weren't for me.
Alan: What are you talking about?

Danny: If I hadn't gone undercover and found the link between the mob and the 
drug ring, the feds would have shut down spaulding permanently.

Alan: Danny, you want me to thank you for the way that drug bust was bungled? 
My sister is in jail being charged with a crime that was committed by brad 
green. Gus's sister was killed in a warehouse explosion that you set off.

Danny: No, no, no. I don't want you to thank me. I want you to listen to my 
proposal for fifth street. Now, there have been some potential backers who have 
become a little skittish because of the junk that they've been reading in the 
papers, but i know you've got a lot more business sense than the rest of them. 
Josh lewis, for one.
Alan: So the righteous have all jumped ship, huh?
Danny: Yeah, something like that.
Alan: Very well. I'm listening.
Jeffrey: You've really got to get it together, mrs. Winslow.
Cassie: Thank you.
Jeffrey: Whoa. Having a bad day?

Cassie: Really bad day. I think they're stalking me. I was just trying to 
call you.
Jeffrey: Okay, what happened? Did you see who it was?

Cassie: They got into my house and they were messing with my computer. Then 
someone stole my sunglasses, and then I went down to the garage, and both my 
tires were slashed, and then I heard someone coming after me, but then a car was 
coming after me, but that turned out to be edmund.
Jeffrey: Wait. Slow down. All right, you need a drink. Come on.

Cassie: No, what I need is for you to find out who is doing this to me. Now 
it feels real. Now they're here, jeffrey. They were in my house. My children 
could have been there.

Jeffrey: They were in your house? They were at the farm? You're sure about 
that?
Cassie: Well, I wasn't until this.

Cassie: It was in my closet at the farm, and I know it's the same one. The 
boys. Jeffrey, the boys...

Jeffrey: The boys... the boys... the boys are fine. They boys are with mrs. 
Chitwood out by the pool. Everyone's safe, okay? Everyone is safe. Now, tell me

Cassie: In the garage under the car. The person left this and they wanted me 
to know that they were in my house.
Jeffrey: Does edmund know about it?
Cassie: No. No, I couldn't tell him.
Jeffrey: Well, why not?

Cassie: Because I was afraid how he was going to react. Jeffrey, you have to 
find them. You've got to find them. My kids have been through so much. (Sobbing)
Jeffrey: Take it easy. Take it easy. Come here. It's going to be all right.

Michelle: Catch. I'm putting water skiing on the weekly agenda, I'm telling 
you.

Tony: Yeah, I'm sure you are. Listen, did you have any idea what you were 
doing when you grabbed that tow rope and the boat was pulling you around? Did

Michelle: No. No, but it looked like fun, and it was.

Tony: Yeah, well, even if you... (laughs) even if you belly-flopped, which

Michelle: Thanks for noticing, but it was amazing.
Tony: Well, you're amazing, michelle. You know that?
Michelle: Really?
Tony: Yeah, you are.
Michelle: You mean that?
Tony: Don't let it get to your head, okay?

Michelle: Yeah, no problems there. You know, you're really the only person 
here who says something like that and means it. Everyone else is just being nice 
and humoring me until I get my memory back, until I snap out of it.
Tony: In my opinion, there's nothing to snap out of.
Michelle: Thank you.
Tony: Mm-hmm.
Michelle: You know, I'm finally taking your advice.
Tony: Well, I'm not sure if that's a good thing. What did I say?

Michelle: You told me not to worry about the person I turned out to be, that 
everyone would adjust and if they couldn't or didn't, that's their problem, not 
mine.
Tony: I said that?

Michelle: Mm-hmm. Yeah, and you're right. You know, first you save my life, 
and then you gave me the okay to live my life the way i wanted, and I owe you 
for that.
Tony: Uh-uh.
Michelle: Yeah.
Tony: Uh-uh.
Michelle: No, I do.
Tony: You do not owe me anything. Nothing.
Michelle: I do.
Tony: No.

Michelle: You've given me a lot, tony, and if things actually work out with 
danny and me, it's going to be because of you.

Danny: Alan, I'm telling you, fifth street is going to be the up-and-coming 
neighborhood of springfield, and all I'm trying to do is finish the last few 
projects that I started. Now, if you take a look, these are the figures right 
here. And I'm willing to open my books to you, if that's what you want. That is 
no problem for me, and you can see that this is the kind of investment that will 
pay well into the future, and not just for springfield, but for you and for your 
grandchildren. And here I've got some projected earnings, and based on what I've 
already accomplished there, frankly, I think they're pretty conservative myself. 
Yeah. Thank you for your time. I appreciate it.
Alan: Well, danny, don't give up so easily. Come on.
Danny: Alan, either you want in or you don'T.
Alan: I didn't say I wasn't interested.
Danny: You didn't say anything.
Alan: All right. Here. Here is my offer to you.
Danny: (Scoffs) you're not serious.

Alan: You don't expect me to pay top dollar for something you can't even give 
away, do you?
Danny: Alan, this... this isn't even close.

Alan: Think about it, danny. You've got five minutes. Take it or leave it. 
Tell gus to come in on your way out.
Marina: So, how did it go?

Danny: (Sighs) well, if I were out on the street-- which could be any day 
now-- I guess alan's offer would be very generous.
Marina: He tried to rip you off.
Danny: Yeah. Big surprise.

Marina: Look, danny, you're better off not getting mixed up with the

Danny: Yeah. You're next, chief.
Gus: Right.
Marina: I was here first.

Alan: Well, son, I am so glad to see you. So, sit down and tell me about your

Gus: Just when I thought this family had hit an all-time low, I see that it

Cassie: I couldn't show edmund the cape. I mean, you should have seen the

Jeffrey: Well, I can't say i blame him.

Cassie: I haven't seen that look in a long time. Edmund has come a long way,

Jeffrey: But edmund's brand of protection is dangerous.

Cassie: I'm not saying that. I just don't want to put him in that position,

Jeffrey: I understand, i think.

Cassie: But I don't want you to get the wrong idea about edmund, okay,

Jeffrey: Okay.

Cassie: Look, I'm telling you this because edmund loves me and he's thinking

Jeffrey: Hmm.

danny, I am going to open a

You need capital, a lot of

Tony.

Danny: I haven'T.

Danny: You don't have a wife and a kid to support.

Danny: It'd have to be a pretty big box.

Danny: Yeah.
Alan: Phillip has made the coopers a more-than-generous offer, gus.

Gus: Listen to me. All the money in the world couldn't get buzz to part with

Alan: You cannot get sentimental about something like this. Change is always

Gus: The coopers don't deserve this, okay, so you stop the project.
Alan: I can't do that. You see, phillip is in charge.
Gus: What, are you saying you can't stop phillip? Of course you can.

Alan: I can't, but if you want to, maybe you should consider coming back to

Gus: Wait a second, wait a second. Is that why you let phillip get so far

Alan: No, not at all. But it would give you an opportunity, gus, to help your

Gus: Why do you even have to ask that?
Dinah: I'm sorry to see you upset like this.

Edmund: That's interesting, considering you're the reason I'm upset like 
this. Filling my head with doubts about cassie, about jeffrey, doubts about me.
Dinah: I was just trying to help.

Edmund: (Laughs) "just trying to help." Well, why don't you come clean, dee, 
or whoever you are? Why don't you come clean and tell me your full name and 
address and a telephone number?

Dinah: So you can tell jeffrey? Do you have any idea what he would do to me

Edmund: Why should I care? Why shouldn't jeffrey o'neill be like every other 
man? Why shouldn't he be attracted to cassie? She's a beautiful, desirable 
woman.
Dinah: She's one of a kind, that's for sure.

Edmund: And she loves me. So I don't care if jeffrey o'neill has feelings for 
cassie. I don't care. I don't care if he's hanging around springfield when he's 
on leave from the feds. I don't care. He doesn't stand a chance because she 
still loves me.

Dinah: Jeffrey plays dangerous games with women. You don't trust him. You 
told me that yourself.
Edmund: No, I don't trust him, but I do trust cassie.
Dinah: Then why are you attacking a woodpile like an ax murderer?

Edmund: Why are you doing this to me? Why? I mean, you drop by here and you 
stuff poison in my ear abut jeffrey, about... about... about... about cassie. 
And then you disappear without a trace. And here I am left to pick up the pieces 
of innuendo and threats about cassie and the life we're trying to build 
together. What is this about?

Dinah: I'm sorry. I understand. You know, I know what it is to love someone, 
have a beautiful place like this, and then something happens one day and they're 
gone. And once you've known a love like that, you don't get over it. You can'T.
Edmund: What is that about? Is that about you and jeffrey?

Dinah: This is about you and cassie. You need to focus on cassie, and 
whatever jeffrey's up to, don't doubt cassie. And if I am responsible for 
putting any doubts in your mind...
Edmund: You're sorry, I know. You said that already. You're sorry.
Dinah: Yes. Where are you going?

Edmund: I'm going to get things back on track with the woman I love, and then 
I'm going to forget everything you ever told me.
Cassie: Did you just ask me to move in with you?
Jeffrey: Look, it's a strategy, mrs. Winslow, not a proposition, okay?
Cassie: I can't just leave the children.

Jeffrey: I don't want you to leave the children. I want you to bring the 
children here, of course. That farm is out there, it's isolated, it's 
unprotected, and it's unsafe. I can maintain better security here.

Cassie: It's not much better here. Rj and I were almost flattened by a 
planter out front, and my tires were slashed in the parking garage here.

Jeffrey: It is better here. It's still better here than the farm. Someone 
just went out there and rifled through your closets, mrs. Winslow. Come on.
Cassie: I just want to burn my clothes.

Jeffrey: Don't burn your clothes, bring them here. I can recommend the

the attack.

Cassie: I am on the attack. I'm having a new security system installed here

Jeffrey: You don't understand. Listen to me. If I get you and the kids here, 
out of the farm, I can use the farm to spring a trap for whoever this is that's 
doing this. Okay? I can lure them there and put them out of commission once and 
for all. So what do you say?
Cassie: Okay. Okay.
Jeffrey: Okay, good.
Cassie: On one condition.
Jeffrey: Any condition you want.
Cassie: You have to work with edmund every step of the way through this.
Jeffrey: (Laughs) you've got to be kidding me, right? You just said...
Cassie: Then no deal. No deal.

Jeffrey: Mrs. Winslow-- cassie-- are you going to tell me you're just going 
to hang around and wait for the next attack because we won't include lover boy?

Cassie: You know, maybe edmund's right. Maybe you're just trying to get me so 
scared that I just come running to you for your protection. Maybe all this is 
just so you can get me alone.
Jeffrey: Maybe that's true. Can you blame me?

Alan: Gus, you can't spend the rest of your life with one foot in this family 
and one foot out.
Gus: Listen to me...
Danny: Time's up, alan.
Alan: Danny, it's not a good time. I'm talking to...
Gus: Forget it. I'll wait outside.

Danny: You said five minutes. It's been over ten. Don't worry, this isn't 
going to take long. You made your offer. Here's mine.
Alan: Good. "Kiss off"?
Danny: I think that pretty much says it all.

Marina: Yeah. That goes for me, too. You know, you can throw me in jail if 
you want to, but I have brought you your last double skim milk latte, big guy.
Alan: Well, good riddance, miss cooper.

Marina: Don't think I'm not grateful to you for everything that you've taught

Danny: Well, there you have it. You ready to blow this joint?
Marina: You bet.
Danny: Have a nice day, gentlemen.

Alan: Well, let's hear it for the little people, huh? What? You don't condone 
what they just did.

Gus: It's just funny to see her get all fired up, you know? A little fiery

Alan: I'm afraid that ship has sailed.

Gus: I'm not so sure about that. Marina said that harley was looking for me

Alan: She wanted you to stop phillip, that's why.

Gus: Well, you know, fine. I'll take whatever I can get. So when you slow

Alan: I told you that is not going to happen.
Gus: Excuse me. Excuse me. You owe me at least that.
Alan: So you're asking me to choose between my two sons, is that it?
Gus: Yeah, I guess I am.
Michelle: Home sweet home.
Tony: Yeah? This really is your home, isn't it?

Michelle: Well, it's where i feel most comfortable. Does that make it my 
home?
Tony: Yeah, sure. Pretty much.
Michelle: Got a message.
Tony: Yeah, I noticed.

Michelle: Danny wants me to meet him at the spaulding offices. Wonder what

Tony: Well, there's only one way to find out.

Michelle: True, true. And I guess I'd better change because I'm sure there's,

Tony: And you care, right?

Michelle: Well, I don't care, but I hate to ruin his deal showing up in a

Tony: You know, I'll bet if you play a game with alan spaulding, you know,

Michelle: You'd think so, wouldn't you? But I kind of get the feeling that

Tony: Sounds like the "perfect wife" stuff is coming back, huh?

Michelle: Not exactly. I just want, you know, danny to be fine and so I can

Tony: Hmm.
Michelle: I guess I do. All right. I'll see you later, partner.
Tony: Mm-hmm.
Michelle: Good meeting.
Cassie: You've deliberately been trying to scare me just to get close to me?

Jeffrey: Mrs. Winslow, get over yourself, okay? I don't want to share my 
bedroom with you. I just want you in the rooms next to mine so that we can 
monitor them around the clock, okay? But you're still resisting. I told you and 
edmund that this identity theft thing was a lot more dangerous than you thought 
it was, but edmund has been putting it into your mind that I'm just trying to 
scare you so that I can make another notch on my belt.
Cassie: He still thinks that.

Jeffrey: Well, then, that's his problem, okay? As a matter of fact, it's your 
problem now, too, because you're going to have to convince him that that's not 
true.
Cassie: Yeah, well maybe this will be the clincher. It sure was for me.

Jeffrey: Why don't you just show it to him, okay? I'm sure that he might not 
take it the wrong way.
Cassie: Well, what now?

Jeffrey: Now we make our move, okay? And we've got to act fast. And you, 
you're going to have to inform eddie.
Cassie: I'll do that tonight. I'll tell him everything.
Jeffrey: All right.
Edmund: Why wait? There's no time like the present.

Danny: Ross, I understand that michelle and tony are pressuring you, but 
we'll stall them. Do whatever you have to do to block those building permits. 
Great. Great, thanks. So, felt good, huh? Blowing off the big boss man.

Marina: Definitely. And I was just talking to my grandpa, and he said that i

hour raise because I'm standing up for such an important cooper value.
Danny: Good.
Marina: Never letting the spauldings get to you, no matter what.
